aca-fmt/6.name: Lotus Approach Index File
aca-fmt/6.description: A file exclusively containing database indexing

fmt/277.name: ESRI Arc/View Shapefile Index
fmt/277.reasoning: Picked up and used by the GIS-procesor

fmt/319.name: ESRI Spatial Index File
fmt/319.description: A 2 part indexing file for spatial data
fmt/319.reasoning: Picked up and used by the GIS-procesor

fmt/331.name: Autorun Configuration File
fmt/331.description: A Windows file usually found on CDs or DVDs or Blurays, telling the OS what executable to run when the disc is played

fmt/394.name: DS_store file (MAC)
fmt/394.description: A macOS file used by the operating system to store folder metadata, like icon position and bg image

fmt/473.name: Microsoft Office Owner File
fmt/473.description: A temporary file created by Windows Office when a document is open, containing account logon info

fmt/475.name: Microsoft Management Console Snap-in Control file
fmt/475.description: Related to Microsoft administrative file control

fmt/500.name: Internet Explorer for Mac cache file

fmt/503.name: AppleDouble Resource Fork 2
fmt/503.description: The resource fork is a construct of the Mac OS operating system used to store structured data in a file, alongside unstructured data stored within the data fork. The format specification is available here: http://support.apple.com/kb/TA32537?viewlocale=en_US The format lacks an extension, and is instead represented by a file name consisting of ._<filename resource fork belongs to>
fmt/503.reasoning: It might not be preservation-worthy, but either way we don't know how to handle it

fmt/509.name: Adobe PostScript Font Metrics file
fmt/509.description: Part of the PostScript Type 1 font format family. On Windows, Type 1 fonts consist of a PostScript Font Binary (.PFB) file, plus a corresponding PostScript Font Metrics (.PFM) file. (Some very old Type 1 fonts may ship with a .PFB, .AFM, and .INF file. Installing such fonts will create a .PFM file from the .AFM and .INF files.)

fmt/524.name: Microsoft Office Theme
fmt/524.description: Exclusively contains font, color, layout, etc. template settings for a Microsoft Office document

fmt/525.name: Adobe Printer Font Binary
fmt/525.description: Part of the PostScript Type 1 font format family. On Windows, Type 1 fonts consist of a PostScript Font Binary (.PFB) file, plus a corresponding PostScript Font Metrics (.PFM) file. (Some very old Type 1 fonts may ship with a .PFB, .AFM, and .INF file. Installing such fonts will create a .PFM file from the .AFM and .INF files.)

fmt/526.name: Adobe Font List
fmt/526.description: A cache of font files installed for Adobe products, createed by the programs themselves

fmt/589.name: Windows Media Playlist
fmt/589.description: A structured, XML-like file containing a sequence of music files that makes up a given playlist

fmt/599.name: Microsoft Word Macro-Enabled Document Template 2007 onwards

fmt/627.name: Microsoft Excel Macro-Enabled Template 2007
fmt/627.description: A Microsoft Excel template file with macros enabled

fmt/634.name: Microsoft Compiled HTML Help
fmt/634.description: A Microsoft Compiled HTML Help file

fmt/670.name: PKCS #7 Crytographic Message File
fmt/670.description: Cryptographic message file which follows email files

fmt/682.name: Thumbs DB File XP
fmt/682.description: Windows OS file, contains folder metadata

fmt/886.name: HTML Components
fmt/886.description: A web script file, usually Javascript, meant to be integrated with other HTML files

fmt/1082.name: ASP WebService Directive File
fmt/1082.description: Defines XML Web service attributes for Active Server Pages

fmt/1132.name: Netscape Bookmark File Format
fmt/1132.description: A bookmark in the Netscape web browser

fmt/1258.name: Microsoft Access Workgroup Information File
fmt/1258.description: A file containing usernames and passwords for users and groups that require access to a specific Microsoft Access database

x-fmt/58.name: Microsoft Excel Web Query
x-fmt/58.description: An Excel web server query, which can be used in an Excel file to retrieve data from a web server

x-fmt/128.name: Microsoft Excel Workspace
x-fmt/128.description: Contains context information for workbook projects, such as which ones are part of the project, the position of the window, etc.

x-fmt/191.name: AMI Professional Document
x-fmt/191.description: A file from the AMI wordprocessor

x-fmt/225.name: ESRI MapInfo Data File
x-fmt/225.description: A helper file for .mid GIS files
x-fmt/225.reasoning: Will be picked up by the gis-processor

x-fmt/280.name: XML Schema Definition
x-fmt/280.description: A prescriptive XML template, for validating XML files with

x-fmt/332.name: Lotus 1-2-3 Spreadsheet Formatting File 3.0
x-fmt/332.description: It's a file containing formatting information for Lotus spreadsheets

x-fmt/412.name: Java Archive Format
x-fmt/412.description: A Java archive file containing a Java project

x-fmt/415.name: Java Compiled Object Code
x-fmt/415.description: Java byte code - not human readable

x-fmt/420.name: Windows Setup File
x-fmt/420.description: Windows Setup File or Installer Script

x-fmt/428.name: Microsoft Windows Shortcut
x-fmt/428.description: A pointer to a different file

x-fmt/441.name: AutoCAD Database File Locking Information
x-fmt/441.description: A temporary file created by AutoCAD when a file is opened for editing, detailing when and by who the file was edited
